Description: Handle-plate of perhaps red-figured Attic pottery column-krater; interior glazed with band in added red at top; exterior: on top, black palmette and volutes; on edges, ivy wreath between lines; underside: partly glazed streaky black; neck glazed as far as preserved.
Dimensions: Width: 6.20 centimetres (of plate at front edge)
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 493, no. C26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0169) (Phase 1)
